title: Select committee will be appointed to look into holding of PC elections: Leader of the House
byline: A select committee will be appointed to look into the holding of Provincial Council elections and the system as a whole, Leader of the House Bimal Rathnayake announced in Parliament today.

title: Some Railways Department officials have illegally leased out bungalows: Minister
byline: Some officials attached to the Railways Department have unlawfully leased out railway bungalows to tourists, Minister of Transport Bimal Rathnayake told Parliament today.

title: No legal obstacle to use state funds to pay estate workers’ incentives: Vijitha
byline: Claiming that no legal bearing of opposition claims on allocating state funds for the payment of estate workers’ attendance allowance, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said yesterday Rs. 5,000 million was allocated to the Plantations Ministry and not to increase wages of workers in a private company.

title: Rs. 1Mn each allocated to district, divisional secretariats under ‘Praja Shakthi’
byline: The Government has allocated Rs. 1 million to every District Secretariat and Divisional Secretariat across the country as part of the ‘Praja Shakthi’ National Programme aimed at modernising public administration.

title: Seven killed, 27 injured in explosion at police station in India’s Kashmir, NDTV reports
byline: At least seven people were killed and 27 injured when a large pile of confiscated explosives in a police station in India’s Kashmir detonated late on Friday, broadcaster NDTV reported, citing sources.

title: Govt is aware that some bureaucrats are corrupt, lethargic
byline: The government is well aware that some bureaucrats are corrupt and lethargic but does not victimise them, Leader of the House Minister Bimal Rathnayake said.

title: Sex workers join force for legal recognition
byline: Around 10,000 female sex workers of Sri Lanka have organised themselves under a common banner to push for their legal and social recognition.

title: 2026 examination calendar released
byline: The Examinations Department has announced the full timetable for national examinations in 2026, outlining what officials describe as one of the most tightly structured academic calendars in recent years.

title: Sri Lanka at an advantageous position to bring in value-addition for exports: Deloitte India
byline: Sri Lanka is at an advantageous position to bring in value-addition stages for its exports but to do so, significant focus needs to be given to bring in the necessary policies, infrastructure and administrative measures, said Deloitte India Executive Director Direct Tax Policy Vijay Chauhan.

title: Azam ends century drought as Pakistan seal Sri Lanka ODI series
byline: Babar Azam hit his first international century since August 2023 to lift Pakistan to an emphatic eight-wicket win over Sri Lanka in the second day-night international on Friday.

title: PC elections will be conducted- Bimal
byline: Leader of the House Minister Bimal Rathnayake said in Parliament today that the provincial council elections would be conducted for sure.

title: Father who raped his daughter sentenced to 12 years rigorous imprisonment
byline: Colombo High Court sentenced a father who pleaded guilty to raping his 14-year-old daughter to 12 years of rigorous imprisonment. As the accused admitted to the charge before court, the sentence was imposed without any fine or compensation order.

title: Video of tourist sexually harassed by local man goes viral
byline: A video showing a foreign female tourist being sexually harassed by a Sri Lankan man has gone viral on social media.

title: Namal accuses Govt. of repressing state employees, Urges public to join Nugegoda rally
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa today accused the government of engaging in severe repression against state sector employees and called on the public to remain patient during what he described as a challenging period.

title: Over 100mm rainfall expected as atmospheric disturbance persists
byline: A low-level atmospheric disturbance lingering to the east of Sri Lanka is expected to bring widespread showers and thundershowers across several parts of the island in the coming hours, said the Meteorology Department.

title: ASPI rebounds from sharp intraday drop to close flat amid heavy volatility
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange witnessed a highly volatile trading session, with the ASPI plunging 187 points during the first hour before staging a strong recovery by midday. Despite continued fluctuations throughout the afternoon, the index ultimately closed nearly flat, down just 1.71 points, as investors navigated sharp intraday swings. In contrast, the S&P SL20 declined 22.22 points, reflecting selling pressure on key blue-chip counters.

title: Writ petition against alleged LGBTIQ tourism promotion fixed for Feb. 10
byline: A writ petition challenging the legality of an alleged endorsement by the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) and the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau (SLTPB) of projects aimed at promoting and developing LGBTIQ tourism in Sri Lanka was today fixed for hearing on February 10 by the Court of Appeal.

title: CCB asks for security after officers threatened in Matara tree-cutting program
byline: The Coconut Cultivation Board (CCB) has asked the Defense Ministry to provide security for its officers who are cutting down 5,000 diseased coconut trees in the Matara District.

title: Second reading of Budget 2026 approved; three opposition MPs voted in favor
byline: The second reading of the 2026 Budget was approved in Parliament with a majority of 118 votes, as 160 MPs voted in favour and 42 voted against.

title: Commuters can now pay fares using credit, debit cards
byline: Commuters will be able to pay bus fares using bank-issued credit and debit cards on buses fitted with ticket-issuing machines from November 24, 2025, Minister of Transport Bimal Rathnayake announced today (14).

title: SLMC wants doctors to fix their handwriting
byline: The Sri Lanka Medical Council (SLMC) has issued a reminder to all medical professionals to strictly follow official guidelines when writing and recommending prescriptions, citing growing concerns over patient safety.

title: Ex-world champion Parker fails drugs test for cocaine
byline: Former world heavyweight champion Joseph Parker is facing a possible ban from boxing after testing positive for cocaine.

title: Over 16,000 nabbed in nationwide anti-drug operation
byline: More than 16,000 people have been arrested during the countrywide anti-narcotics operation “Nation United – National Drive,” launched to eradicate drug trafficking and related crimes.

title: Ronaldo receives first red card in 22 years; risks ban at World Cup
byline: Cristiano Ronaldo is at serious risk of being banned for the first game of the 2026 World Cup if Portugal qualifies as expected.

title: US and SL sign MoU to formalize Montana National Guard Partnership
byline: The United States and Sri Lanka today formalized a new phase of security cooperation with the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the Montana National Guard, the U.S. Coast Guard District 13, and the Sri Lanka Armed Forces under the State Partnership Program (SPP).

title: British envoy meets Tilvin Silva
byline: British High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Andrew Patrick held discussions with Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) General Secretary Tilvin Silva during a visit to the party’s headquarters in Pelawatta, Battaramulla.

title: Sri Lankan stabbed to death in Israel
byline: A Sri Lankan man working in Israel has been tragically killed in a stabbing incident. The victim has been identified as K.K. Tharindu Shanaka, 38, a father of two from Batapola, Kondagala in Galle, who had arrived in Israel in September 2025 to work as a carpenter in the construction sector.

title: Australian schools shut over asbestos risk in children’s sand
byline: About 30 schools in Australia have been fully or partially closed after a warning over asbestos risks in children’s sand.

title: Sri Lanka’s ambassador to Nepal presents credentials to President Paudel
byline: Ruwanthi Delpitiya, the newly appointed Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Nepal, presented her Letters of Credence to President Ramchandra Paudel at a formal ceremony held at Rastrapati Bhavan in Kathmandu yesterday.

title: Hundreds of illegal lunch sheet factories operating across the country, Industry Association warns
byline: The All Ceylon Small Industries Association has raised alarm over the existence of between 400 and 500 illegal factories manufacturing substandard and banned lunch sheets used for wrapping food across the island.

title: Rally on Nov. 21 only to remind govt of its promises – Namal
byline: SLPP Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa says the opposition’s rally scheduled for November 21 in Nugegoda is aimed at reminding the government of the promises it made to the public.

title: Vijitha Herath ends minister’s list for overseas employment
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath has announced that the Minister’s list will no longer be used to send workers abroad, highlighting the urgent need to retain talent in Sri Lanka.

title: Birthrate slows among elephant population in Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka’s wild elephant population has seen a 21 per cent birthrate decline according to the latest consensus, compared with the last one conducted 13 years ago.

title: First U.S. case of human bird flu in 9 months confirmed in Washington state
byline: The person was infected with a strain that has previously been reported in animals but never before in humans.

title: Namal Rajapaksa briefs ITAK General Secretary on opposition rally
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa said he met Illankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) General Secretary M.A. Sumanthiran to brief him on the 21st public rally organised by the opposition against the National People’s Power (NPP) government.

title: Gold prices fall by Rs. 10,000 in local market
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka saw a sharp decline today (15), dropping by Rs. 10,000 compared to the previous day, traders at the Colombo Pettah gold market said.

title: Pakistan’s army has always been influential - now its chief has new powers
byline: Pakistan’s parliament has voted to give army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir new powers and lifetime immunity from arrest and prosecution, a move that critics say paves the way towards autocracy.

title: Teamwork to Ignite Champs Kandy SC
byline: ’’We don’t have stars or big names, but we have a bunch of players who are ready to play for one another.’’

title: ODEL launches ‘Christmas 2025
byline: ODEL unveiled its Christmas 2025 theme, “The Stage Is Set,” in Colombo on Thursday (13), introducing a rock ’n’ roll–inspired festive experience across its stores.

title: Schoolgirl stabbed, ex-soldier found hanging
byline: A 28-year-old former soldier, suspected of fatally stabbing a 16-year-old schoolgirl, has reportedly taken his own life by hanging himself, police said.

title: Watagala sends LOD over apartment claim
byline: A demand letter seeking Rs. 10 billion in compensation has been issued against SLPP activist Mahinda Pathirana over an alleged defamatory statement made against Deputy Minister of Public Security Sunil Watagala.

title: Shah Rukh Khan launches Dubai Tower named after him
byline: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan was recently honored with a skyscraper in Dubai named after him.

title: CAA tightens price controls on canned fish
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has imposed fresh maximum retail prices on several canned fish varieties in an effort to curb price volatility and strengthen regulatory oversight across the food sector.

title: IPL Retentions 2026: CSK set to release Matheesha Pathirana
byline: Chennai Super Kings have decided to release Matheesha Pathirana into the auction pool, just a year after retaining him for Rs 13 crore last year. The Indian Express understands that the franchise continues to have concern around Pathirana’s fitness and the sort of impact his slightly remodelled action has caused to his bowling and given the uncertainty, releasing him to the auction pool will give them an opportunity to strengthen the squad.

title: Pelawatte party office not linked to government: PM
byline: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) headquarters in Pelawatte is not linked to the government but a place where we discuss our political stability and where our party makes all political decisions,’’ Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: Deputy Minister lives in an apartment valued Rs.500Mn, says opposition MP
byline: Opposition MP Chaminda Wijesiri, while firing allegations against ruling party members, said a certain deputy minister lives in an apartment valued Rs.500 million, and asked who donated it to him. However, he did not mention the deputy minister’s name.

title: TPA backs wage hike but calls for clear implementation – Barath Arullsamy
byline: The Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) has expressed support for the 2026 Budget’s proposed daily wage increase for plantation workers, while urging clear implementation and wider structural reforms.

title: First U.S. case of human bird flu in 9 months confirmed in Washington state
byline: The person was infected with a strain that has previously been reported in animals but never before in humans.

title: NPC orders major reshuffle in senior police ranks
byline: The National Police Commission (NPC) has approved several transfers and appointments of senior police officers to strengthen key divisions within the Sri Lanka Police.

title: Oversight Committee recommends green substitute for sili sili bags
byline: The Sectoral Oversight Committee on Environment, Agriculture and Resource Sustainability has recommended that the Ministry of Environment take the lead in producing an environmentally friendly paper bag to replace polythene “sili sili” bags.

title: COPE probes delays in East Container Terminal project
byline: The Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) has held extensive discussions on the prolonged delays in the construction of the East Container Terminal (ECT) at the Colombo Port and the issues arising from the setback.

title: Lalith Pathinayake’s acting role ends as NPC makes new appointments
byline: The National Police Commission has approved the appointment of Senior DIG Sanjeewa Dharmaratne as the Senior DIG in charge of Police Administration.

title: UNP raises concerns over President’s remark at Maha Viru Samaruma
byline: The United National Party (UNP) has raised concerns over a remark made by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the 36th Il Maha Viru Samaruma, claiming that a key comment was deliberately excluded from the official record of the event.

title: China warns citizens against Japan travel as Taiwan spat escalates
byline: China has warned its citizens against traveling to Japan as it escalates a backlash over comments by the country’s prime minister about the island of Taiwan.

title: Arugam Bay alleged sexual assault: Police hunt suspect
byline: Pottuvil Police are appealing to the public for assistance in locating a suspect involved in an alleged sexual assault of a foreign woman in the Arugam Bay area on October 25.
